revised_title: Discovery of an Ancient Well and Antiquities in Kirkbythore, Westmorland
tldr: A well was discovered in Kirkbythore, Westmorland, containing Roman artifacts, earthen vessels, and other antiquities. The well was covered by a wooden plank and had two large wooden vessels at the bottom. The artifacts included Fabritian plate, pottery, and sandals, indicating the well's historical significance and its connection to Roman Britain.
